intro: Mostuea neurocarpa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with contrasting markings. Its leaves are velvety and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
